news_header: China's economy struggles post-COVID-19 with weak domestic demand and a real estate crisis, while the US under Trump considers tariffs on Chinese imports.
news_original_title: China scrambles to find Trump antidote in Year of the Snake
news_text: Since the end of the COVID-19 pandemic, China's economy has faced significant challenges, including weak consumer spending and a persistent real estate crisis. Despite a reported 5% growth in 2024, driven largely by exports, many Chinese citizens feel little improvement in their economic situation. The US, under President Trump, is contemplating tariffs on Chinese imports, which could further impact China's reliance on exports. The trade surplus with the US has reached record levels, raising concerns about domestic consumption and corporate profitability in China.
